title: Gross domestic product ( GDP ) growth rate in Singapore 2024
yAxis: GDP growth compared to previous year
summary: The chart at hand is a line chart where the x axis denotes Year and a y axis denotes GDP growth compared to previous year. In total the number of data points it has is 11.
Overall GDP growth compared to previous year has decreased over the Year.

GDP growth compared to previous year is roughly constant from 2014 to 2018, slightly decreasing from 2018 to 2019, gradually increasing from 2019 to 2022, and finally roughly constant from 2022 to 2024.
The line significantly decreased by 2.59 from Year 2018 to 2019, and lastly, increased by 0.44 from Year 2019 to 2020.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2018 and 2019.
Maximum GDP growth compared to previous year, about 3.9 was reported at Year 2014
The lowest GDP growth compared to previous year, of value 0.55 was reported at Year 2019
